t: 1 Corinthians 11
Be*p ye followers of me, even as I also am of Christ.
Now*p I praise you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances, as I delivered them to you.
But*p I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of Christ is God.
Every*p man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonoureth his head.
But*p every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with her head uncovered dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she were shaven.
For*p if the woman be not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.
For*p a man indeed ought not to cover his head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.
For*p the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.
Neither*p was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man.
For*p this cause ought the woman to have power on her head because of the angels.
Nevertheless*p neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man, in the Lord.
For*p as the woman is of the man, even so is the man also by the woman; but all things of God.
Judge*p in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?
Doth*p not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?
But*p if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: for her hair is given her for a covering.
But*p if any man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.
Now*p in this that I declare unto you I praise you not, that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.
For*p first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.
For*p there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.
When*p ye come together therefore into one place, this is not to eat the Lord's supper.
For*p in eating every one taketh before other his own supper: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.
What?*p have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? or despise ye the church of God, and shame them that have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praise you not.
For*p I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the same night in which he was betrayed took bread:
And*p when he had given thanks, he brake it, and said, Take,*r eat:*r this*r is*r my*r body,*r which*r is*r broken*r for*r you:*r this*r do*r in*r remembrance*r of*r me.*r

After*p the same manner also he took the cup, when he had supped, saying, This*r cup*r is*r the*r new*r testament*r in*r my*r blood:*r this*r do*r ye,*r as*r oft*r as*r ye*r drink*r it,*r in*r remembrance*r of*r me.*r
For*p as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye do shew the Lord's death till he come.
Wherefore*p whosoever shall eat this bread, and drink this cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.
But*p let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of that bread, and drink of that cup.
For*p he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord's body.
For*p this cause many are weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.
For*p if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.
But*p when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.
Wherefore,*p my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.
And*p if any man hunger, let him eat at home; that ye come not together unto condemnation. And the rest will I set in order when I come.
